title: ADDIE Model-Based Image Utilization Science Education Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science theories and educational management experience
context.additional_context: Targeting elementary education administrators/leaders in corporations, aiming to enhance the effectiveness of science education using image resources.

learning_goals: Improving the ability to develop image-based educational materials by applying the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation).

Learners will design a 10-minute instructional methodology plan using three types of diagrams/infographics for corporate science education settings, implement it in an actual training session, and achieve ≥80% satisfaction in participant comprehension surveys.

During a two-week mid-term course, learners will conduct peer evaluations using a predefined rubric (engagement 40%, comprehension 30%, applicability 30%) for 10 image materials (field photos, infographics) generated from corporate science education programs (e.g., safety training, process management) and achieve ≥80% attainment rates.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
